option.displayvalues: No history(only keep pages of the day)|Keep 1 week of history pages|Keep 2 weeks of history pages|Keep 3 weeks of history pages|Keep 1 month of history pages|Keep 2 months of history pages|Keep 3 months of history pages|Keep 4 months of history pages|Keep 5 months of history pages|Keep 6 months of history pages|Keep 1 year of history pages|Keep ALL history pages (never purge)

Report output options : paper format, paper size, fonts, test names, page break, output folder mode...

option.desc: Specify if the fonts will be embeded in the PDF file. The file size will be higher if the fonts are embeded but it can fix some problems on some OS (Mac,...).
option.label: Embed fonts in PDF file
option.tooltip: Specify if the fonts will be embeded in the PDF file. The file size will be higher if the fonts are embeded but it can fix some problems on some OS (Mac,...).

option.desc: Specify here the printer to use in order to print PDF reports. HtmlDoc is HTML4 only but daemon compatible, so to be used if YM or PM run as daemon. Qt printer is HTML5/CSS compatible but not daemon compatible: to be used for some characterization reports if high number of conditions and some tables cut.
option.displayvalues: HtmlDoc|Qt printer
option.label: PDF printer
option.tooltip: Specify here the printer to use in order to print PDF reports. HtmlDoc is HTML4 only but daemon compatible, so to be used if YM or PM run as daemon. Qt printer is HTML5/CSS compatible but not daemon compatible: to be used for some characterization reports if high number of conditions and some tables cut.

option.desc: specify here the default output format for the generated reports.
option.displayvalues: Web (HTML pages)|Document DOC (Word, OpenOfficeWriter,...)|Spreadsheet CSV (Excel,OpenOfficeCalc,...)|Presentation PPT (PowerPoint,OpenOfficeImpress,...)|Document PDF (AdobeAcrobat,...)|Interactive only (no document created)|OpenFormat text document (OpenOffice,MS Word,...)
option.label: Output format
option.tooltip: specify here the default output format for the generated reports.

option.desc: Paper orientation (for DOC and PDF reports only)
option.label: Paper orientation
option.tooltip: Paper orientation (for DOC and PDF reports only)

option.desc: Maximum number of characters allowed in a test name...(disable:-1, default: -1)

option.desc: Base directory to be used to generate reports.

option.label: Include page breaks in Html pages

option.label: Number of significant figures
option.tooltip: Number of significant figures : -1 set to the maximum number of digits

option.desc: Speed optimization
option.label: Speed optimization : optimize analysis Speed vs. Datasets size
option.tooltip: Speed optimization

option.displayvalues: Always compute Skew, Kurtosis, Quartiles, Median and distribution Shape|Only if processing 50Mb of data or less|Only if processing 100Mb of data or less|Only if processing 200Mb of data or less|Only if processing 300Mb of data or less|Only if processing 400Mb of data or less|Only if processing 500Mb of data or less|Never compute advanced statistics
option.label: Computing advanced statistics, distribution shape (heavy data crunching)
Data Processing options : Test number handling, Sorting, Fail count, Data Cleaning,...

option.displayvalues: Ignore test name: always merge tests with identical test number|Ignore test#: always merge tests with identical name|Never merge tests with identical test number if test name not matching
option.label: Handling duplicated test numbers and name

option.displayvalues: Hide PartID|Show PartID in report & charts
option.label: PartID display

option.displayvalues: Using X,Y coordinates|Using Part ID|Auto-detect
option.label: Part identification

option.displayvalues: Use spec limits if any|Use standard limits only|Use spec limits only
option.label: Used limits

option.displayvalues: No smart scaling on data computation (leave results in default units)|Re-scale to most appropriate units (eg: mV, uV, etc.)|Re-scale all units to limits units|Normalize all units (eg: V, A, etc.)
option.label: Normalize / Scale

option.displayvalues: None: process data files using import order|By date: sort data by testing date
option.label: Sorting mode

option.displayvalues: None: process data files using import order|By XY : sort data by XY coordinates|By PartID: sort data by PartID
option.label: Sublot sorting mode

option.desc: Remove all filtered samples
option.label: Clean samples results
option.tooltip: Remove all filtered samples

option.displayvalues: Stop on first fail|Continue on fail
option.label: Failure count mode

option.displayvalues: Use limits only (ignore pass/fail flag)|Use pass/fail flag if valid (otherwise use limits)
option.label: Parameter pass/fail rule

option.displayvalues: Merge: merge ALL pins/results under same test name|Do NOT merge: show each pin/result as a different test
option.label: Merge or Split tests?

option.displayvalues: Min (of test values)|Max (of test values)|Mean (of test values)|Median (of test values)|First test value in run|Last test value in run
option.label: Merge criteria

option.displayvalues: Keep all results per run|Keep only one result per run
option.label: Merge option

option.desc: Test name build instructions
option.label: Test name
option.tooltip: Specify here how to build the test name: GSCurrentTest.GetTestName(), GSCurrentTest.GetPinChannelName(), GSCurrentTest.GetPinLogicName(), GSCurrentTest.GetPinPhysicName(), ... Default: GSCurrentTest.GetTestName() + ((GSCurrentTest.GetPinPhysicName() == '') ? '' : ' - ' + GSCurrentTest.GetPinPhysicName())

option.desc: Test number build instructions
option.label: Test number
option.tooltip: Specify here how to build the test number: GSCurrentTest.GetTestNumber(), GSCurrentTest.GetPinIndex(), ... Default: GSCurrentTest.GetTestNumber() + '.' + GSCurrentTest.GetPinIndex()

option.desc: Pin name build instructions
option.label: Pin name
option.tooltip: Specify here how to build the pin name: GSCurrentTest.GetPinChannelName(), GSCurrentTest.GetPinLogicName(), GSCurrentTest.GetPinPhysicName() Default: GSCurrentTest.GetPinPhysicName()

option.displayvalues: Same folder as Data files|User defined location
option.label: Storage folder

option.displayvalues: Stringent: Ignore records not in line with STDF specs|Flexible: Examinator does its best to recover any data
option.label: Handling STDF compliancy issues

option.displayvalues: None|N*sigma|Exclude N*sigma (Inliner filtering)|N % (percent of limits space)|Q1-N*IQR and Q3+N*IQR
option.label: Data Cleaning mode

option.displayvalues: Remove sequencer name|Remove pin name
option.label: Format test name

option.displayvalues: Use largest|Use first|Use last
option.label: Limit selection criterion

option.displayvalues: Per site: use limit selection criterion for each individual site|Over all sites: use limit selection criterion and apply to all sites
option.label: Scope

option.displayvalues: Enable support for functional tests|Disable support for functional tests
option.label: Enable/Disable support for functional tests
Algo to allocate mem for test results

option.displayvalues: From summary data (if any), otherwise from samples|From samples (if any)|From summary data only|From samples data only
option.label: How are stats computed
Fields to include in report table

option.displayvalues: Test name|Test type(parametric, functional, ...)|Test limits|Spec limits|(Test Vs Spec) Limits variation|Statistics computation mode(eg: Samples, Summary, ...)|Executions count|Failures count|Failures '%' (over production)|Failing bin associated with test/parameter|Test flow ID (test order in testing sequence)|Nb. of removed data points (through data cleaning)|Mean|Sigma|2*Sigma|3*Sigma|6*Sigma|Min. : Minimum result found (P0.0%)|Max. : Maximum result found(P100.0%)|Range|Cp|Cr|Cpk|Yield|Multi limits
option.label: Standard fields

option.displayvalues: EV: Repeatability|AV: Reproducibility|R&R|GB GuardBand|PV Part Variation|TV Total Variation|P/T Ratio
option.label: Gage study fields

option.displayvalues: Distribution shape|CpkL (Cpl)|CpkH (Cpu)|Skew|Kurtosis|Percentile 0.5% (P0.5%)|Percentile 2.5% (P2.5%)|Percentile 10.0% (P10.0%)|Q1: 1st quartile (P25.0%)|Median/2nd Quartile (P50.0%)|Q3: 3rd Quartile (P75.0%)|Percentile 90.0% (P90.0%)|Percentile 97.5% (P97.5%)|Percentile 99.5% (P99.5%)|IQR Interquartile range|IQR SD Interquartile Standard Deviation
option.label: Advanced fields

option.displayvalues: Mean shift|Student's T-Test p-value (alpha=0.05)|Sigma shift|Max. range|Cp shift|Cr shift|Cpk shift
option.label: Compare study fields

option.displayvalues: Reference group only|All group combinations
option.label: Compare calculations to include

option.displayvalues: Use percentile formula|Use standard Sigma formula
option.label: Cp, Cpk formulas

option.displayvalues: Sort by Test Number|Sort by Test Name|Sort by Test Flow ID (test execution order)|Sort by fail count|Sort by Mean|Sort by mean shift|Sort by sigma|Sort by Cp|Sort by Cpk|Sort by gage R&R% value (by decreasing R&R% value)
option.label: Sorting mode

option.displayvalues: Percentage of limits|Percentage of value
option.label: Correlation ALARM formula for the Mean

option.desc: Title of the 'Wafer map' section in the report
option.label: Title of the 'Wafer map' section in the report
option.tooltip: Title of the 'Wafer map' section in the report

option.desc: If > 0, used to replace effective die count when computing yield related results.
option.label: Gross Die
option.tooltip: If > 0, used to replace effective die count when computing yield related results.

option.displayvalues: Use mean|Use median
option.label: Parametric stacked wafermap

option.displayvalues: Bin count|Pass/Fail (PASS if all dies are PASS)
option.label: Bin stacked wafermap

option.displayvalues: All individual wafers|One combined wafer per group / query (wafer stacking)|Bin mismatch (when comparing two wafers)|Bin to bin color correlation (when comparing two wafers)
option.label: Wafermaps to include in report

option.displayvalues: Accept comparing wafers with different size|Include die mismatch table (may be big if a lot of mismatching dies)|Include delta yield section
option.label: Comparing wafers

option.displayvalues: Highest bin: promote the highest bin value for each die|Last bin: use last bin value found for each die
option.label: Retest policy

option.displayvalues: X-axis swap: Swap Left dies with Right dies|Y-axis swap: Swap Top dies with Bottom dies|When swaping on X/Y axis, also swap the notch|Full wafer: Display full wafermap (device filtering restricted to samples only)|Always round: Resize dies to always make the wafer look round
option.label: Visual options: Mirrors axis, Force round shape, Full wafer, etc...

option.displayvalues: Right: Positive X increases going Right (default)|Left: Positive X increases going Left|Auto: from data file
option.label: Define 'Positive X' Probing direction

option.displayvalues: Down: Positive Y increases going Down (default)|Up: Positive Y increases going Up|Auto: from data file
option.label: Define 'Positive Y' Probing direction

option.displayvalues: From data file if specified, else detect flat|From data file if specified, else use default (set in below option)|Detect flat (ignore data file flat/notch location)|Use default (set in below option)
option.label: Define flat/notch location

option.displayvalues: Active flat/notch location differs from the one specified in data file|No flat/notch location specified in data file
option.label: Alarms

option.displayvalues: Black outline border for dies re-tested (soft/hard bin wafermaps only)|Write value in die (Measurement, bin# or count)|Write % in die (Wafer Stacking only)
option.label: Markers to draw on chart

option.displayvalues: Consider check result as an error |Consider check result as a warning
option.label: Wafer map orientation check policy

option.defaultvalue: 'select min_group, count(*) as n from shift_alerts group by min_group order by n desc;'
option.label: Extra queries to report
option.tooltip: Addtionnal SQL querie(s) (separated by ;) that will be reported at the bottom of the report as usual table(s) after the default ones. Contact the support team in order to get the correct query(ies) for any custom additionnal table(s).
